benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/cache - Invalidates the given Cache if specified, otherwise invalidates all caches

covered: Valid Deletion Scenarios: TC01, TC02, TC08 demonstrate successful invalidation of all caches or a specific cache with appropriate status codes and empty bodies.

Edge-case handling for cacheName input: TC05 (empty), TC10 (very large), TC11 (special characters), TC12 (mixed-case with case sensitivity), and TC15 (regression invalid format) cover input validation and error handling.
Existing and non-existing caches: TC03 (non-existent) and TC04 (exists but not alive) verify proper 400 responses and no cache invalidation.
Authorization and error handling: TC06 (unauthorized), TC07 (system error) verify 401/403 and 500 responses with no cache invalidation.
Query parameter handling: TC09 confirms extra unsupported parameters do not break operation.
Performance and scalability: TC13 tests large number of caches; TC14 tests concurrency; TC15 regression case, covering stable behavior under load and concurrency.
No caches case: TC08 ensures 204 with empty body when there are no caches.
gaps: Rate limiting/testing: no tests for rate-limiting or throttling on DELETE requests.
Caching headers: no tests verifying ETag/Cache-Control semantics on DELETE responses.
Soft deletes semantics: tests focus on invalidation rather than a persistent delete flag; no explicit soft-delete verification.
Race-condition coverage: TC14 covers concurrency but not an explicit single-cache race scenario (two clients invalidating the same cache concurrently).
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests to ensure endpoint resilience under burst traffic (e.g., multiple concurrent DELETEs per second).
Add tests for HTTP caching headers on DELETE responses if applicable; verify presence/absence of Cache-Control or ETag semantics.
Introduce explicit soft-delete semantics tests if the domain supports a soft-delete concept for caches (e.g., a deleted flag) or clearly document that invalidation is the only behavior.
Add targeted race-condition tests for concurrent invalidation of the same specific cache to ensure no partial invalidation or inconsistent states.
